paper_abstract: In 1989, an effort to solve the game of checkers began. It was naive because of the daunting size of the search space, 5 x 10(20) positions, and because of computer capabilities of the time. Nevertheless the work continued, with the final calculation completing in 2007. The result? Perfect play by both sides leads to a draw. Checkers is the largest popular game that has been solved to date.
paper_title: Game over: Black to play and draw in checkers
